skill.name: typescript-write
skill.description: Write TypeScript and JavaScript code following Metabase coding standards and best practices. Use when developing or refactoring TypeScript/JavaScript code.
skill.summary: Write TypeScript and JavaScript code following Metabase coding standards and best practices. Use whe...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and guidelines for TypeScript/JavaScript development. It has no executable code, network access, or file system operations. The content provides development workflow instructions and coding standards.

content.user_title: Write TypeScript code with Metabase standards
content.value_statement: Writing TypeScript that follows consistent patterns improves code quality and team collaboration. This skill provides Metabase coding standards and development workflows for professional TypeScript development.
actual_capabilities: Provides TypeScript linting and formatting commands
Guides TypeScript testing patterns and commands
Explains Metabase coding style and conventions
limitations: Only provides guidance, no automatic code generation
No integration with external development tools

use_cases.title: Follow consistent coding standards
use_cases.description: Apply Metabase coding conventions to maintain consistency across TypeScript and JavaScript codebases.

use_cases.title: Standardize development workflow
use_cases.description: Establish unified practices for linting, formatting, and testing TypeScript code in team environments.

use_cases.title: Learn project conventions
use_cases.description: Quickly understand Metabase coding standards and development commands when joining a project.

prompt_templates.title: Basic TypeScript help
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the TypeScript coding standards and conventions I should follow for this project?

prompt_templates.title: Testing guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I run TypeScript unit tests and what commands should I use for testing specific files?

prompt_templates.title: Code quality
prompt_templates.prompt: What commands do I use to lint and format my TypeScript code according to project standards?

prompt_templates.title: Development workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the complete development workflow for TypeScript code including linting, testing, and formatting.

output_examples.input: How do I run TypeScript tests for a specific file?
output: To test a specific TypeScript file, use: yarn test-unit-keep-cljs path/to/file.unit.spec.js
To run tests matching a pattern: yarn test-unit-keep-cljs -t "pattern"

best_practices: Run linting and type checking before committing code changes
Follow the autonomous development workflow with small, testable increments
Use the provided yarn commands for consistent development practices
anti_patterns: Don't skip linting and formatting steps in the development workflow
Avoid editing files outside the project folder scope
Don't commit code without running tests first

faq.question: Is this compatible with standard TypeScript projects?
faq.answer: Yes, the commands and principles work with any TypeScript project, though some commands are Metabase-specific.

faq.question: What are the limitations of this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance only - it doesn't generate code or integrate with external tools beyond yarn commands.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing development tools?
faq.answer: The skill provides standard yarn commands that work with most TypeScript development environments.

faq.question: Is my code data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only provides documentation and doesn't access or modify your code files.

faq.question: What if the yarn commands don't work in my project?
faq.answer: Check your package.json for the correct script names or adapt the commands to your project's configuration.

faq.question: How does this compare to other TypeScript development tools?
faq.answer: This focuses on Metabase conventions and workflows rather than being a general TypeScript development tool.
